it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.controller

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.newdem.adrenaline.controller.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    A Timer object calls methods on a given TimerListener object with time criteria.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer(int syncPeriod, TimerListener lst)
      Initializes the timer instance.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort()
      Aborts the timer, calling timerDidAbort() on the associated listener.
      int getSecondsLeft()
      Returns the seconds left for the timer to end its countdown.
      boolean isOver()
      Returns whether the timer countdown is over.
      void pause()
      Puts the timer in pause state, freezing the countdown until Timer#resume() is called.
      void reset(int seconds)
      Forces the timer to the given countdown length.
      void resume()
      Resumes a timer that previously switched to a pause state by Timer#pause().
      void start(int seconds)
      Starts the timer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer(int syncPeriod,
             TimerListener lst)
        Initializes the timer instance.
        Parameters:
        syncPeriod - The period in seconds between two synchronization callbacks.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if syncPeriod is non-positive or if the listener is null.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(int seconds)
        Starts the timer.
        Parameters:
        seconds - The seconds left to the end of the countdown.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if seconds is non-positive.

      • abort

        public void abort()
        Aborts the timer, calling timerDidAbort() on the associated listener.

      • reset

        public void reset(int seconds)
        Forces the timer to the given countdown length.

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        Returns whether the timer countdown is over.

      • getSecondsLeft

        public int getSecondsLeft()
        Returns the seconds left for the timer to end its countdown.

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Puts the timer in pause state, freezing the countdown until Timer#resume() is called. Calling this method on a Timer in pause state will cause the discharge to be ignored.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Resumes a timer that previously switched to a pause state by Timer#pause(). Calling this method on an ongoing Timer will cause the discharge to be ignored.
